Such factor Xa inhibitors include, for example, 2,7-bis-(4-amidinobenzylidene)-cycloheptanone and N(α)-tosyl-glycyl-3-amidinophenylalanine methyl ester ("TENSTOP"), which have effective inhibitory concentrations (Ki's) of about 20 nM and 800 nM, respectively.
ATS, which is isolated from the leech, Haementerin officinalis, contains 119 amino acids and has a Ki for factor Xa of 0.05 nM.
TAP, which is isolated from the tick, Ornithodoros moubata, contains 60 amino acids and has a Ki for factor Xa of about 0.5 nM.
